choices: Go to the large outlet store
1.content:
You wake up to the sound of your alarm going off. The buzzing sound is probably the most irritating thing that you have ever heard. You would think that having listened to it for the past four years you would be able to tune it out; but alas, the clock is still capable of doing its job well.

Hopping out of bed, you walk to the bathroom to take a shower. You smile at the reflection in the mirror. Your shoulder-length blonde hair is messed up from a night of tossing and turning while you try to get comfortable.

You spend about an hour primping and preening as you ready yourself to go to the mall. Sarah agreed to meet you at ten, and you are both excited about finding the perfect dress. Sarah has been complaining that you're always late, so today you are hoping to prove her wrong.

By the time you are ready to leave you only have a half hour before you are late. Sarah lives on the opposite side of town, so it made no sense for the two of you to carpool.

Grabbing your purse, you rush outside and get into your car. The drive is slow due to Saturday morning traffic. Now you remember why you like to sleep in. Fortunately, you still make it to the mall on time.

Sarah is waiting for you by the main fountain. She gives you a big hug when you approach. Her disbelief in your punctuality is worth having woken up early.

"There's a new place down at the far end of the mall," Sarah states pointing towards one branch of the mall. "Or we could just check out the large outlet store right here."
1.title: Saturday Morning

11.content:
The new store is tucked way back in the corner of the mall. Above the entrance is a sign that says, "Morganville". You think its an odd name for a store, but shrug it off as you enter.

There are cases full of jewelry near the register. All kinds of t-shirts are hung on the wall, and formal dresses galore sit on racks spread around the store. In the back of the store are several shelves with underwear and lingerie. Again, you find the store name odd considering the merchandise that is being sold.

"Is there anything I can help you with?" A young woman behind the counter asks as you and Sarah enter.

"We're looking for dresses for Prom." You reply glancing towards several of the racks.

"We have quite the selection here," The saleswoman answers. "We have all kinds of styles from the 1920s to the ultra-modern. Don't forget to check out our jewelry section too. And if you're looking to surprise your boyfriend after the dance, we have all kinds of lovely intimates in the back."

Sarah giggles at the saleswoman's words and immediately heads to the back.

None of the dresses immediately catch your eye so you decided to look at something else.
11.title: Go to the new store

111.content:
The jewelry case is full of all kinds of odd trinkets. You weren't entirely sure what each stone was, but they looked to be the ordinary, run of the mill, sapphires, rubies, and emeralds.

"Let me know if there is anything that you want to get a better look at," The saleswoman states, getting her keys out.

"Could I see that emerald necklace with the silver chain, please?" You ask the saleswoman.

Unlocking the case, she reaches in and pulls out the necklace. It sparkles in the light and you are entranced by it. The emerald was a simple stone laid in silver, with a thin silver chain. The price tag stated that it was sixty dollars.

The saleslady allows you to try the necklace on. She holds up a mirror while you examine yourself. The necklace is absolutely stunning. Your heart is aching to buy it; however, if you buy it then you won't have enough money to buy a dress.
111.title: Inspect the jewelry

1111.content:
"I'll take it!" you declare firmly as you inspect yourself in the mirror.

The necklace looks astounding on you. It makes your eyes sparkly in the light, and you imagine that you are more beautiful than ever. Of course, it's just a necklace, but it seems to have given you more confidence.

"I take it that you're going to be graduating soon?" The saleslady asks, making small talk while ringing up your purchase.

"Yes, I'm a senior," You reply. "I think this will look good with my Prom dress that I haven't bought yet."

"I'm sure that you will find a lovely dress." The saleslady answers, handing you back the necklace.

"I just wish that I had a boyfriend to take me to Prom," You sigh, as you place the necklace around your neck.

The saleslady's eyes widen in terror.

"Be careful what you wish for!" She stammers, pointing at the necklace as it begins to glow.

The glow of the necklace quickly faded. It struck you as odd, but it must have just been your imagine. Looking around the store, you don't see Sarah anywhere, so you decide to wait outside.

Upon exiting the store you are greeted by a handsome, yet somewhat geeky young man about your age.

"Did you find you were looking for, sweetie?" He asks, as he bent down and gave you a quick kiss on the lips.

"Who are you?" You reply blushing slightly.

"It's me, Sarah, your boyfriend," The boy replies, taking your hand in his. "Are you ready to get lunch?"

"But, Sarah is a girl," You stammer, as you are led through the mall.

"We've been over this a lot," Sarah grumbled. "My parents have a weird sense of humor. At least they didn't name me, Susan. Now do you want to go get something to eat, or would you rather we find you a dress?"
1111.title: Buy the necklace

11111.content:
Sarah, your new boyfriend, leads you to the food court. There are quite a few options to choose from and you are having trouble making up your mind because you have more important things to think about. Finally, you decide to tell Sarah to pick something out for you.

Sarah agrees and he wanders off to one of the vendors. Knowing that you've got at least five minutes to yourself, you begin to process everything that has happened. That's when it hits you; the glowing necklace must have granted your wish. For the mere price of sixty dollars, you are now the owner of a wishing necklace!

Now, you smirk wickedly, thinking about all of the fun that you could be having.

"I wish Sarah was more muscular," You say aloud, causing your necklace to glow slightly.

You look around for Sarah, but don't see him anywhere.

"I wish that I had already bought the perfect dress," You muse, resulting in the necklace glowing again.

"This is a lot of fun," you think to yourself as you look down at a bag that has appeared by your seat. Inside is an emerald green gown with embroidered beadwork.

Holding up the necklace up to the light, you give it a small kiss to show your appreciation. On the back of the necklace, for the first time, you notice the inscription, "Four wish maximum".

"Rats!" You think to yourself, having already used three of your wishes.

"Better make my last wish you count," You muse out loud. "Do I want to have the most magical Prom ever, or do I want to have a life filled with happiness and comfort?"
11111.title: Get lunch

111111.content:
"I wish to have the most magical Prom ever!" You exclaim, causing the necklace to glow.

As far as you can tell, nothing has changed. You shrug your shoulders. Maybe the magic will only work once Prom arrives.

Sarah returns with a tray of food for the two of you. Together, you eat lunch and talk about your plans for Prom. Sarah agrees to pick you up at six on Saturday at your house before going out to dinner.

After lunch, you head to your car to leave. Sarah gives you a quick goodbye kiss before you get into your car and drive back home.

The week is long and tedious, and you are looking forward to the dance. When Saturday finally arrives, you spend all morning at the salon getting your nails done and your hair styled. You grumble at how much it costs and wish that you had a friend with rich parents.

Six o'clock finally arrives and you anxiously await Sarah's arrival. Sarah arrives in a black tuxedo with a green vest and bowtie matching your own green dress. Photos are taken by your parents before Sarah whisks you off to dinner.

Once dinner is over, Sarah drives you to the dance that is being held in the reception hall of a nearby hotel. As soon as you enter the reception hall, a chill runs down your spine. Something seems out of place, but you can figure out what it is.

You are starting to get a little thirsty and want to leave to get a drink, but Sarah insists that you get your photos taken first.
111111.title: Most magical Prom ever

1111111.content:
You look around the gymnasium. A lot of your classmates are already dancing and having a good time. There are a lot of people that you don't recognize. Surprisingly enough, there are also some children running around and trying to dance. As you continue watching the crowd, you notice that several people haven't apparently hybridized with animals. There are boys wearing dresses and girls wearing tuxedos. You wouldn't believe it if you hadn't seen it yourself.

Walking over to the refreshment table, you find quite the magnificent spread. There are several kinds of punch, as well as scones, biscuits, cookies, chocolates, and cake.

Even though you are incredibly thirsty, and you already ate dinner, you are having trouble deciding between punch or a snack.
1111111.title: Get a drink

11111111.content:
You and Sarah both take a glass of punch and begin to sip it. A strangle tingling comes across your body as you feel yourself beginning to change. You can feel your dress stretching as you begin to grow.

Looking at Sarah, you are shocked at what you see. Sarah has transformed into a girl. You look yourself over and realize that the punch transformed you into a boy.

Sarah giggles as she grabs your now masculine hand and drags you onto the dance floor. There are quite a few boys wearing dresses, as well as girls wearing dresses. Nobody seems to mind the oddness of wearing the clothing of the opposite gender. Everyone is having a genuinely fun time.

After an hour of dancing, you and Sarah have a seat. Both of you are getting tired, but the dance won't be over for a few more hours. You are trying to decide if you want to get a snack, or leave the dance early.
11111111.title: Drink the punch

111111111.content:
The snacks have dwindled from earlier. Apparently, everyone has had a craving for the delicacies. All that remains are chocolate chip cookies and blueberry biscuits.

It's a tough choice, but you're hungry enough that you both look good.
111111111.title: Get a snack

1111111111.content:
You grab a chocolate chip cookie and take a bite. The cookie is so good that you can't help but devour the entire thing. As you finish swallowing the cookie, you feel a familiar tingling sensation.

The world begins to get larger as you start to shrink. Thankfully, your dress shrinks as well. Sarah giggles as she watches you shrink down. She had only eaten half of her cookie and decided against eating the other half as she watched your transformation.

When you had finally stopped shrinking, you appeared to be about two years old. It was quite the odd sensation. First the punch had made you a boy, and now the cookie had made you a toddler. A strange padding could be felt under your dress. you were forced to look and were shocked to see that you were now wearing a diaper.

Sarah had shrunk as well. Having only eaten half the cookie, she did transform as dramatically. She looked to be about nine years old.

Grabbing your hand, Sarah pulled you onto the dance floor. You tried to dance with as best as you could, but the bulky padding between your legs made it difficult. Nevertheless, you were having fun. Apparently, the magic made it so that nobody was embarrassed by the transformations.

The clock began to strike twelve and you felt the tingling begin. With each stroke of the hour, you began to get older and revert to your female self. Within seconds, everybody had returned to their normal bodies. Boys were no longer wearing dress, and girls were no longer wearing tuxedos.

Sarah drove you home and gave you a long kiss goodnight. You smiled as you watched your boyfriend drive off into the night. This certainly was a magical Prom. Hopefully, you'll be able to find some way to create that magic again.
1111111111.title: Eat the cookie

1111111112.content:
You pick up a biscuit and take a bite out of it. The flavor is intense. You feel your mouth begin to tingle as you swallow it. Sarah also ate a biscuit and you could tell that she was beginning to feel the effects as well.

Slowly, a pair of pointed ears began to form on your head. A hole opened up in your dress and a tail slowly emerged through. You resembled a half man/half fox creature.

Looking at Sarah, she had grown a pair of cat ears, as well as a cat tail. She purred seductively at you as you grabbed her hand and led her back to the dance floor.

Your now muscular frame spun Sarah around the dance floor the rest of the night. As the clock struck midnight, you leaned down and planted a firm kiss on Sarah's lips. At the last stroke of twelve, you began to feel a tingling sensation.

Looking around, you had reverted to your original female self. Sarah had turned back into a boy and was filling out his tux nicely.

Sarah drove you back to your house and gave a you a nice long kiss goodnight. You smiled as you watched your boyfriend drive away. This was certainly a magical Prom and the memories would be with you forever.
1111111112.title: Eat the biscuit

111111112.content:
You decided that it is time for you to leave the dance. You're not sure if you should drink more punch before you leave, but you and Sarah both shrug it off. Being a guy could be pretty cool and Sarah is fascinated with being a girl.

As you walk through the door, you feel a tingling sensation again. Looking down, you have reverted to your old body. Sarah in turn has reverted to her old male body. Apparently, your first wish took precedence over later wishes.

Sarah kisses you goodnight after she drops you off at your house. Your evening at Prom was certainly magical, and you will remember it for the rest of your life.
111111112.title: Leave the dance

11111112.content: The snacks looked too good to pass up. You had the choice between a blueberry biscuit and a chocolate chip cookie.
11111112.title: Eat a snack

111111121.content:
You smile at your boyfriend, Sarah, before slowly biting into the chocolate chip cookie. Sarah just grins back at you as he watches you chew. Something seems wrong though. You feel a strange tingling as soon as you finish the cookie.

Looking up at you Sarah, you notice that he seems to be getting taller. Then you realize, that he isn't getting bigger, you are getting smaller. When the tingling finally stops, you realize that you are now a toddler. Your dress shrunk with you, but it was short enough that the diaper you are now wearing is on display for everyone to see. You panic for a moment, but the giggle. Apparently, the magic of the evening is keep everyone from feeling embarrassed.

Sarah decides to hold off on the snacks and he spends the remainder of the evening acting like your babysitter. At times, he feels more like a big brother than your boyfriends. He still dances with you on the dance floor, but you are inclined to stand on his feet as he holds your hand.

You get your photos taken before the photographer leaves. As he hands you the picture he tells you to hold onto it forever.

"This is a magic photo," He explains. "It will allow you to come back and revisit this night whenever you stare at it long enough."

Sarah carries you back into the gymnasium. It was kind of nice having him be strong enough to carry your miniature body around.

As the clock strikes twelve you have Sarah lean down so you can give him a quick peck on the cheek. With the chime from the clock you begin to get older and taller. Once the clock has finished chiming, you wrap your arms around Sarah and give him a real kiss.

Sarah drives you back to your house to drop you off. He gives you a big kiss before getting back into his car and driving home. You know for sure that you are never going to forget that Prom. Whenever you want to revisit it, all you have to do is stare at your photograph. This was truly a magical Prom.
111111121.title: Eat the cookie

111111122.content:
You grab a blueberry biscuit and take a bite. The taste is divine and within seconds you have devoured the entire dessert. A strange tingling courses through your body. You watch Sarah as he begins to transform. Within several seconds, Sarah has grown a pair of fox ears and a bushy tail has sprung out the back of his tuxedo.

"How do you like your ears?" Sarah asks you.

"My ears?" You reply, confused.

Then you notice that you have a pair of cat ears on your head, as well as a cat tail that has emerged from a newly formed hole in the back of your dress.

The two of you laugh as you drag Sarah onto the dance floor. Everyone at the dance appears to have had some kind of transformation. Nobody seems embarrassed. Apparently the magic makes everyone less embarrassed and allows them to just enjoy the magic for what it is.

Before you know it, the clock is chiming midnight. Sarah pulls you close and wraps his tail around yours. He leans in and kisses you softly on the lips. You sigh softly as your ears and tail slowly recede into your body.

As soon as the dance is over, you notice that everyone has transformed back to normal. You all leave the gymnasium and return to your homes.

Sarah drops you off at your house. He looks you in the eyes before giving you a long kiss goodnight. Finding the magic necklace was the best thing that ever happened to you.

You smile as you watch Sarah drive away from your house. In a few weeks you will be graduating. Then, you will have all summer to spend with your boyfriend before you move away to college. The lingering feeling that this was the most magical Prom ever will be with you forever.
111111122.title: Eat the biscuit

1111112.content:
You and Sarah decided to get your photos taken first. Sarah wraps his arms around you as the photographer snaps the picture. Within minutes, the photo is developed and framed and handed to you. Strangely enough, as you stare at the photo you the image of you and Sarah begins to move around. The people in the picture are as alive as you are, albeit they can't speak to you.

"Whenever you want to re-live this night, just gaze deeply into the photograph," The photographer explains to you as he gives you a wink.

You stick the photo into your purse and you and Sarah head inside. The decorations are amazing. The theme for your senior Prom is "Wizards and Witches: A Night of Magic". The entire gymnasium is decorated like a wizards castle. Electric candles are suspended from the ceiling by strings. A fog machine covers the dance floor in a light mist.

You and Sarah have a grand time. Every time a slow song comes on, Sarah grabs you with his big strong hands and holds you tightly throughout the song.

As the clock strikes midnight, the lights slowly begin to return to the gymnasium. You gasp as you look around. The entire gym is deserted, except for you and Sarah. Your shock is dispelled as Sarah leans in and kisses with you. His lips are warm, and his embrace is tender.

The gymnasium begins to transform again, this time to a bedroom. The room is small, with several tiny windows that look out over a lake. The moon is full and is shining into your room. Rose petals cover the bed and floor.

Sarah looks deeply into your eyes before he gets down on one knee. Reaching into his pocket he pulls out a small box. Inside the box is a diamond ring.

"Will you marry me?" Sarah asks as he puts the ring onto your finger.

"Yes!" You gasp as tears begin filling your eyes.

The remainder of the night is unforgettable. The feel of Sarah's hands on your body is mesmerizing. You fall asleep in his arms with the smell of roses surrounding you.

When you awake in the morning, you are back in your own room. You grumble as you think it is all a dream. However, your disappointment is short-lived as you look at your hand and see a diamond ring on your ring finger. The picture you had taken is sitting on a shelf in your bedroom. Inside of the picture, you and Sarah are smiling back. You are able to relive that magical night whenever you so desire.

Graduation comes and goes, and with it summer vacation. Your parents are happy that you and Sarah are getting married; after all, he was the nicest boy that you had ever dated. Their only concern was your schooling. They asked that you wait until you graduate from college before officially getting married.

You had no desire to wait that long, but since your parents were paying for the wedding you happily obliged.
1111112.title: Take photos

111112.content:
"This is really a no brainer," You laugh out loud. "I wish for a life of comfort and happiness."

The necklace glows brightly for a moment before turning dull. Having used all four of your wishes, the necklace appears to have lost some of its luster. You decide that it still looks pretty, and you would hate for someone else to get their hands on your magical necklace.

Just then, Sarah returns with two trays of food. You are impressed at how muscular Sarah looks. She turned from a geeky looking nerd to a star football player.

"Have I told you how wonderful I think you are," Sarah says, looking deeply into your eyes.

You swoon at Sarah's words. She has a chiseled jaw, massive pecs, wavy hair that floats in a breeze, and deep blue eyes. The fact that he is all yours makes it even better.

"I think you're pretty wonderful too," You sigh.

"I just want you to know," Sarah began, "That I am going to make this the best Prom ever."

The two of you spend the rest of the afternoon together. You wrap your arm around Sarah's powerful arms as he guides you along the mall. Finally, you must part for the day, but not before Sarah gives you a firm, yet soft kiss on your lips.

Driving home, you cannot wait for Saturday. The days drag one, with the only positive part of each day is seeing Sarah at school. At one point, you overheard him talking to his football buddies about how wonderful you were.

The night of Prom was magical. Your emerald green dress was the envy of all of the other girls. Sarah treated you to everything your heart could of desired. After the dance, Sarah drove you to a secluded park.

You and Sarah walk along the path, and you can tell that Sarah is increasingly nervous. Finally, you come to a small clearing an Sarah pauses. He looks you in the eye and leans in to kiss you. He wraps his powerful arms around you and you feel your knees going weak.

"You are the most amazing girl that I have ever met," Sarah begins. "I want you to know, that if it was not for your love and support then I would not have gotten a full ride to college. They want me to be their starting quarterback next season. The coach says that I have good chance of playing professionally."

"That's nice," You reply, slightly uninterested.

"But I can't do it alone," Sarah adds, getting down on one knee. "Will you marry me?"

Sarah reaches into a pocket of his tuxedo and pulls out a box containing a diamond ring. You squeal with delight as you wrap your arms around Sarah and kiss him furiously. Tears are streaming down your face as he helps you put the ring on your finger.

When you tell your parents, they are incredibly happy for you. Your mother immediately begins phoning relatives to tell them the good news despite how late it is.

You don't see Sarah for most of the summer as he had to leave for college in order to train with the team. Every Saturday, you are in the stands cheering for Sarah. When winter break rolls around, you and Sarah finally get married in your home town.

Three years later, Sarah is drafted into professional football. On the night that it is announced, you have an announcement of your own. Taking Sarah aside, you tell him that you are pregnant with your first child. Sarah is so ecstatic that he can't help but cry on stage as he holds up his jersey for his new team.

You smile at your husband. Your life is comfortable and you never imagined that you could be so happy.
111112.title: Life of comfort and happiness

11112.content:
"I want to go find a dress," You tell your new boyfriend.

"Okay," Sarah replies, walking you towards the outlet store. "They'll have plenty of dresses in there. I honestly don't know why we didn't go there in the first place."

"We wanted to try that new place, remember?" You ask Sarah.

"I don't remember that," Sarah responded.

"I wish you could remember," You grumble to yourself.

Seconds later, your necklace glows. Several seconds after the glowing stopped, Sarah begins to freak out.

"What the hell is going on?" Sarah screams, looking down at her now male form. "I was a girl this morning and now I'm not!"

It dawned on you that you had just made another wish.

"Calm down, Sarah, and let me explain everything!" You say, trying to calm Sarah down. "For whatever reason, and I have no idea how this happened, I accidentally turned you into my boyfriend."

"That's preposterous!" Sarah whined. "Change me back now!"

"I can't," You lie. "I already tried several times and you're still my boyfriend."

"What are we going to do now?" Sarah demanded an answer.

You could wish Sarah back immediately, but who knows when your wishes are going to run out. On the other hand, it seems that everyone thinks Sarah is your boyfriend and nobody else seems to remember Sarah ever being a girl. If you kept mum about the wishing necklace then you can go to Prom with Sarah as your boyfriend.
11112.title: Go dress shopping

111121.content:
"Fine," You reply glumly, looking up at Sarah with your best attempt at puppy dog eyes. "I'll change you back."

Sarah couldn't help but feel a little moved by your cute appearance, but that did not deter her desire to return to normal.

"I wish that I had not made my first two wishes." You say, causing the necklace to start glowing.

Within several seconds, you are standing back outside of Morganville. Sarah is standing next to you and she has returned to her normal, female self.

"Thank you," Sarah replies as she gives you a hug.

The two of you walk down to the other end of the mall and enter the outlet store. You begin to look through the dress racks hoping to find something that looks good on you. After a half hour of not being able to find anything you look back down at the necklace.

"I wish that Sarah and I have each already bought a unique perfect dress for Prom." You say quietly so as not to draw attention to yourself.

When the necklace finishes glowing, you notice that there is a bag at your feet. Inside the bag is a strapless white gown with a large, black sash around the torso that is tied into a bow in the back. The bead work on the dress is exquisite and included in the bag is a silver tiara.

Sarah approached you holding her own bag. Her dress was a spaghetti strap baby blue affair that was covered in needlework on the front. Several small roses were stitched in a cluster around the torso.

"Ready to go?" Sarah asks you.

"I sure am," You reply, giving your medallion a quick kiss. It is then that you notice on the back of the medallion an inscription that reads, "four wish maximum."

You think to yourself that you need to be more careful with your final two wishes, assuming that you even have two more wishes and the medallion really didn't count your first two wishes.

"I was thinking," Sarah began, "Do you want to drive to Prom, or do you want me to? It's not like we have boyfriends to drive us."
111121.title: Change Sarah back

1111211.content:
Your car was having trouble with the clutch, but you decided that it would be fine for Prom.

The day of Prom arrived and Sarah arrived at your house in the early afternoon. You spent the day doing each other's hair and makeup. By the time it was ready to leave for the dance, your parents were ready to kick you out of the house in order to get some peace and quiet.

Unfortunately, your car did not prove to be as reliable as you had hoped. You and Sarah were stranded along the highway on your way to dinner. To make matters worse, both of you had forgotten your cell phones. The night was quickly shaping up to be a disaster.

"I can't believe this!" Sarah shouted, pounding the dashboard.

"I just wish we could have a decent Prom," You sighed leaning your head back against the headrest.

The sight of red and blue flashing lights caught your attention. A police officer had pulled up behind you and was approaching the car.

"Are you two ladies all right?" The officer asked.

"My car died, and we can't get to Prom." You explained.

"No worries, I can call a tow truck and have them take your car to the mechanic. In the meantime, I'll call your parents and let them know what happened." The officer added. "If you want, I can give you a ride to Prom and have one of my fellow officers give you a ride home afterwards."

You were shocked at the offer and could hardly decline. It looked as if your Prom was not going to be ruined after all. You and Sarah leaped from the car and walked over to the patrol car.

True to his word, the officer dropped you off at Prom. By the time the end of the night arrived, you must have danced with half of the football team and almost all of the chess club. You were shocked at how well mannered the boys in the chess club were. They were incredibly polite and well groomed. You even ended up giving your number to Jeff, the captain of the chess club.

Prom came to a close, and you and Sarah got a ride back to your house by another police officer. Graduation came and went, and with it summer vacation. It was not until you were walking around your college campus that you ran into Jeff. Coincidentally, he had enrolled at your college and you were taking several classes together.

Jeff was a little shy, but still managed to ask you out. At least, you think he asked you out. He was mumbling a lot and sweating. You told them that you would love to go out and he should pick you up at six.

Your first date with Jeff was magical. He was sweet, and caring, and made you laugh pretty much the entire night. By the time your date was over, you were beginning to fall in love. You continued dating Jeff throughout college, and over Christmas of your senior year he proposed.

Prom was but a distant memory, but had it not been for that fateful night then you may never have given Jeff a chance in college. As your wedding day approached, you found yourself looking through your old jewelry box. You came across the old necklace that you had worn for Prom. You thought it would be nice to wear it to the rehearsal dinner and share how it was the same necklace you had worn at Prom. It was then that you saw the inscription on the back, "Four wish maximum."

"Don't I still have one wish left?" You mused allowed.
1111211.title: You drive

1111212.content:
You decide to go ahead and let Sarah drive since your car is having trouble with the clutch.

The week quickly flies by and you have not yet made any other wishes. As far as you can tell, you still have three wishes left. Unfortunately, Prom has become the focal point of your attention and you have completely forgotten about the necklace. As you are getting ready to leave for Sarah's you pause momentarily, a necklace would go great with your outfit. You smile as you rummage through your jewelry box to retrieve the necklace.

Once you are at Sarah's house, the two of you begin getting ready. You spend hours fixing each other's hair and make up. By the time that you are finally ready to leave for Prom, Sarah's mother is at her wits end and ready to boot you both out the door.

"You two are so close you're just like sisters!" Sarah's mother jokingly scolds you two as you head to Sarah's car.

"We're better than sisters," Sarah shouts back. "We're best friends!"

"I wish there were a level higher than best friends, because that's what we'd be!" You giggle as you wave goodbye to Sarah's mother.

You fail to notice the necklace glowing as it grants your wish.

Unbeknownst to you, your wish has been granted. At dinner, Sarah seems overly affectionate towards you and even pays for your meal. Once you arrive to the dance, Sarah insists on holding your hand as you walk inside.

Nothing seems too out of the ordinary though, until the first slow dance. Sarah grabs your arm and pulls you close to her. She wraps her arms around you and the two of you begin to dance across the floor.

"Sarah, what are you doing?" You ask, confused as Sarah leads you along.

"What?" Sarah replies. "A girl can't dance with her girlfriend?"

"I thought we were just best friends," You answer, confused at Sarah's response.

"We're a level higher than best friends, we're girlfriends!" Sarah exclaimed, looking a little hurt.

It dawns on you that you wished for this, even without being fully aware of it. You are still confused, but Sarah is treating you so lovely that it makes the evening bearable.

By the end of the evening, you had completely forgot about wanting to dance with the boys. Sarah was the greatest thing to ever happen in your life. As she drove you back to her house you leaned across the car and rested your head on her shoulder.

"I'm so happy right now," You sighed. "I don't want this evening to end."

"Everything in life has to come to an end at some point," Sarah answers, reaching over and placing her hand on your knee.

"I'm scared about what's going to happen to us after graduation," You mumble.

"We'll cross those bridges when we come to them. The important thing is that we are living each day to the fullest." Sarah replies.

"I know, but I wish we could be happy together forever," You add, closing your eyes and ignoring the glow of your necklace as it granted your wish.

Shortly after Prom, you and Sarah graduated. Both of your parents threw a big graduation party, and it was during the graduation party that Sarah surprised everyone by proposing to you. You were shocked and dismayed, but you knew in your mind that there was no one else you would rather spend your life with.

Both of your parents were incredibly supportive of your decision. Sarah asked that you postpone the wedding until the following summer in order to get a proper reception hall. It was the longest year of your life, but you loved watching Sarah plan all of the details.

Years later, you returned home from work to find Sarah rummaging through your jewelry box. She pulled out the necklace that you had worn to Prom. Smiling, she looked over at you.

"I can't believe that you still have this thing," Sarah declared.

"It was too important to get rid of," You laugh, gazing at the trinket.

"We could have a lot of fun with this," Sarah snickers as a wicked grin crosses her face.
1111212.title: Sarah drives

111122.content:
"I think the best thing for us to do is to playing along and act like nothing is wrong," You tell Sarah. "As soon as we figure out how to change you back to normal then we will."

"I suppose that makes the most sense," Sarah replies glumly. "I was just really wanting to have a great Prom. I was hoping to find the perfect dress and get my hair done, but now it looks like I'm going to have to wear a tux."

Several passersby gave Sarah an odd look. To them, Sarah looked like a normal teenage boy talking about wanting to wear a dress.

"Check your wallet," You instruct Sarah.

Inside Sarah's wallet is her driver's license, school ID car, and about two hundred dollars in cash. Apparently, Sarah was planning on buying your dress today. Hopefully, he'll still remember to pay for your dress even after he gained all of his female memories back.

"We might as well get you your dress now," Sarah replies, flipping through the bills. "It's strange, I remember everything from my life but I also remember my new life."

"So you remember everything that happened in your male life?" You ask, surprised at Sarah's revelation.

"Yeah, I remember playing peewee soccer, dressing up as a power ranger for Halloween, and breaking the heads off of your barbies," Sarah admits. "Those are things that I never did as a girl."

"What else do you remember? How are you feeling about your new body?" You ask, your curiosity is piqued.

"I remember asking you out to Homecoming last semester," Sarah confesses. "I remember being incredibly happy when you finally said yes. I remember our first dance together and our first kiss that night."

"You remember our first kiss and I don't?" You blurt out. "That's not fair!"

Sarah reaches over and grabs your arm. He spins you in a circle before dipping you. You can feel how powerful his new arms are. Leaning his head down, he kisses you. You close your eyes and wrap your arms tightly around Sarah.

"What was that for?" You stutter after Sarah releases you.

"I don't know, it just felt like the right thing to do," He answers you. "Even though I used to be a girl, being a boy and kissing girls just feels right."

You hold Sarah's hand as you continue shopping. A grin has spread across your face and you are radiating happiness. Who would have thought that your best is now your boyfriend.

Prom comes and goes, along with graduation. You spend most of the summer with Sarah. After Prom Sarah had given up trying to find a way to change himself back. You never bothered to tell him about the wishing necklace.

As your senior year of college approaches, Sarah musters up the courage to ask you to marry him. You knew that you had been close, but it was still an honest surprise to you.

Without hesitating, you reply, "yes".

The years go by, and you are blessed with several children. As your twentieth anniversary Sarah rediscovers your wishing necklace in your jewelry box as he was trying to come up with ideas for an anniversary present.

You come into your bedroom and freeze as you see Sarah with the necklace.

Sighing, Sarah looks at you and says, "I'm happy with the way our life turned out, but sometimes I wish I could know what life would have been like if I had never turned into a man."
111122.title: Keep Sarah as your boyfriend

1112.content:
Sighing, you remove the necklace and hand it back to the saleslady.

"It's just too expensive, I can't afford that." You mutter.

As you turn around, you run right into Sarah. She had sneaked up behind you while you were trying on the necklace.

"So you're not going to but the necklace?" Sarah asked slyly.

"No I'm afraid not," You reply glumly.

"That's too bad," Sarah answers condescendingly.

Approaching the counter, Sarah gets the saleslady's attention. As the woman approaches, you hear Sarah laughing to herself.

"Excuse me, but I would like to buy that emerald necklace," Sarah tells the saleslady.

"Excellent choice, I hope this won't cause a rift in your friendship," The saleswoman replies as she rings up the necklace.

"I doubt that it will, I just wish I had a boyfriend to take me to Prom so I could show this off." Sarah sighed.

You glumly walk out of Morganville. Why did Sarah have to be so mean? She was always doing things like that, just because her parents were rich and gave her a credit card. Waiting outside, you feel a tingle in your chest. Looking down, you see that your navy blue tank top was now a blue and white baseball jersey.

Something wasn't right about this situation, but you weren't entirely sure what to do.
1112.title: Don't buy the necklace

11121.content:
"What the hell is going on?" You scream as you rush to the ladies' room. Once inside the bathroom you run straight for the mirror and look yourself over.

You are no longer an average looking girl with shoulder-length blonde hair. In your place stands a mildly athletic young man with a buzz cut. Staring dumbfounded at yourself you fail to recognize that you are now in the wrong restroom until one of the other girls corrects you.

Apologizing profusely you race from the bathroom and crash right into Sarah.

"What were you doing in the ladies' room?" Sarah demanded to know, placing her hands on her hips and giving you the stink eye. "Why can't you be like a normal boyfriend? Why do you have to act all perverted?"

Sighing, Sarah walked into the bathroom after thrusting her bags into your hands. Not wanting to cause any further problems, you wait patiently outside for Sarah to emerge.

"I'm sorry that I was so mean to you, but I worry that you're going to run off with another girl," Sarah says as she comes back out of the restroom. "I love you, I really do, and I wish that we could be together forever."

Sarah's necklace begins to glow. After several seconds, you look around. Something was off, but you couldn't tell what it was. Then you remembered, it was Saturday and you wanted to be at home playing videogames. Nevertheless, you had decided to be the good boyfriend and go dress shopping with your girlfriend Sarah.

"I love you too," You say as you smile down at Sarah.

She really was beautiful. You never knew why a dynamite girl like that would ever go out with you, but you weren't going to complain. You had worked extra hard to make sure Prom was special.

When the big day arrived, you showed up to Sarah's house in a freshly pressed tux while riding in a limo. Sarah's parents oohed and aahed as they took dozens of photos. You finally escaped into the privacy of the limo. Once inside, you and Sarah begin to make out. Your love for her is as deep as the ocean.

After the dance, you take Sarah to a secluded area of the local park where you have laid out a blanket, several pillows, dozens of rose petals, and several candles. You wrap your arms around Sarah and kiss her neck and shoulders. She moans in ecstasy as your hands caress every inch of her body. Taking a condom from your pocket, you slowly undress each other. Several minutes later, you are lying in a heap on the blanket with your arms wrapped around Sarah.

Graduation comes and goes, as does summer vacation. You and Sarah attend the same college and your love for each other grows stronger. One spring evening, three years exactly after that magical Prom evening, you get down on one knee and ask Sarah to marry you.

Sarah is sobbing wildly, but you can still make out a "yes".
11121.title: Freak out

choices: Tell her you don't have a limo reserved for Prom
11122.content:
There was no reason to panic, at least not yet. Your shirt had changed, but you were sure there was a logical explanation for that. Your pants had also become looser, which caused you be at a loss for an explanation.

Something about this wasn't right. You look at your arms, and they look the same. All those reps that you had done in the weight room were really paying off. What was it that was bugging you so much?

Shrugging your shoulders you decide that it wasn't that important. You just wish that your girlfriend, Sarah, would hurry up and finish her shopping. It was bad enough that she was expecting you to pay for the limo, your tux, dinner, and photos for Prom, but now she was dragging you to the mall when you could be at home playing videogames.

"She does have a great set of tits, though." You think to yourself as you smirk.

Sarah walks out of the store and looks around confused. She was really cute when she did that. Deciding it would be a good idea, you sneak up behind her wrap your arms around her.

"Hey, cutie, where do you think you're going?" You laugh as your kiss the back of her neck.

Sarah screams at a decibel louder than you've ever heard before she takes her purse and starts beating you furiously with it.

"What's the big idea, creep?" Sarah shouts loudly as she continues to pummel you with her purse.

A crowd is gathering around, watching what appears to be a petite girl beat an athletic boy to death with a purse. Her blows finally become unbearable and you break down sobbing.

"Sarah, it's me," You try to explain. "What's gotten into you?"

"Who are you, I don't know you!" Sarah demanded, pausing from beating you.

"I'm your boyfriend," You whimper. "You wanted me to go shopping with you today. I thought it would be cute to sneak up on you and surprise when you left Morganville."

Sarah's eyes turned as big as saucers as she realized that her wish had come true. She helped you to your feet and began to kiss you, apologizing all the time. Wrapping her arm around your waist she led you to the food court. Many of the people that had witnessed you being assaulted just snickered or rolled their eyes.

Your pride was wounded, and you figured that it would be best to break the bad news to Sarah now. Maybe after your beating she would be more understanding of your financial situation. You hadn't actually reserved a limo for Prom because you couldn't afford it. If you told her the truth now, then maybe you could get off without having to find an emergency limo service.
11122.title: Stay calm

111221.content:
"Sarah, sweetie," You begin calmly, trying to butter her up. "I've got some bad news. I know that you have your heart set on renting a limo for Prom, but I wasn't able to rent one because I don't have the money."

You wince as you expect another assault from her purse. Instead, Sarah just shrugs and give you a hug.

"That's okay," She replies. "I'll talk to my parents and see if they can pay for it."

You breathe a huge sigh of relief. Having a girlfriend with rich parents certainly had its perks.

"Let me know," You say, looking at Sarah.

Sarah was absolutely stunning. Looking at her always made you smile. You felt incredibly lucky that she would choose to go out with a guy like you. Your football career was pretty much over after blowing out your knee in the first game the season.

"I'm still a little confused," Sarah began looking around. "I came here this morning with my best friend, and I can't find her anywhere."

"Have you tried calling her?" You answer helpfully.

"That's a good idea," Sarah replies as she pulls out her phone.

Sarah punches the number into her phone and within seconds your phone starts to vibrate.

"What the heck is going on?" Sarah mutters, before it dawns on her. "Oh my gosh, I am so sorry!"

"Sorry for what?" You ask, puzzled by Sarah's odd behavior.

"Don't you remember?" Sarah inquires, looking at you.

"No, I don't remember. You asked me to come with you this morning so I could help you pick out a dress."

Sarah grins before she scoots her chair closer to yours. She lays her head on your shoulder and closes her eyes.

"I'm so lucky to have you," Sarah sighs, wrapping her arms around you.

"What's gotten into you Sarah?" You say, enjoying the affections from your girlfriend.

"Nothing, I just realized how wonderful you are."

Your day at the mall draws to a close and you say goodbye to Sarah. Before you leave, she wraps herself in your arms and gives you a big kiss. It's always so cute when she does that.

Saturday finally arrives, and with it Prom. As per Sarah's instructions, you arrive at her house at six o'clock. After getting photos taken by her parents a stretch limo arrives in the driveway.

The limo takes you around town before it drops you off at one of the fanciest restaurants that you've ever seen. Sarah pays for everything with the help of her parent's credit card. After dinner you are dropped off at the dance where you spend the entire evening dancing with Sarah.

You return to Sarah's house and she grabs a backpack and a blanket. The two of you sneak off to a local park to star gaze. Sarah snuggles up close to you and begins kissing you. You return her kisses and before you know it you are making out. Sarah reaches into her purse and pulls out a condom.

Years later, you still think back fondly to your senior Prom. It was the night that Sarah gave herself to you for the first time. At your wedding, you spoke fondly of that night as it was the night you fell in love with Sarah.

No matter what you did in life, you always succeeded. Your house was a mansion and your job paid seven figures. Every time you would bring it up, Sarah would always you remind you about the time you helped her find a dress at the mall.
111221.title: Tell her you don't have a limo reserved for...

111222.content:
"We're going to have a great Prom," You lie to her. "I've got my tux, and a limo, and everything."

"That's good," Sarah agreed. "I'm sorry I was hitting you earlier."

"That's okay, I guess," You reply. "What has gotten into you?"

"I don't know," Sarah answers. "I haven't seen my best friend. She must have ran off. We came here together this morning."

"What are you talking about, Sarah? I met you when you arrived and there wasn't anyone with you." You tell her.

Sarah realizes that you have been magically transformed into her boyfriend. She pauses as she realizes that her necklace granted her wish. Unfortunately, you have no idea about what is going through her head.

The two of you have lunch before you limp out of the mall. Sarah has spent the remainder of the afternoon being extra affectionate to you. She's been hugging you, kissing you, and rubbing your back where she bruised you from your assault.

You feel bad for lying to her, but you really think that you can rent a limo before Prom. However, as the week progresses you have no such luck. The day of the big dance arrives and you have nothing to show for it. You're afraid of what your girlfriend is going to say when you arrive in your own car.

As soon as Sarah steps outside and sees that there is no limo, you attempt to lie your way out of trouble. Unfortunately, Sarah breaks down into an uncontrollable fit of rage. She is sobbing as she screams at you.

Sarah decides not to go to Prom and promptly breaks up with you on the spot. At least now, you don't have to buy two dinners. You go to Prom anyway have fun dancing with some of the other girls from your class. By the end of the night, many of them are flirting with you and telling you how sorry they are about your break up.

Graduation soon follows and before you know it, it is summer vacation. The months fly by and you find yourself starting college. Prom is but a distant memory as you begin your life at college.
111222.title: Lie to her

112.content:
There are all kinds of panties and bras on the shelves in the back. It's no wonder that the store managers kept them in the back instead of on display near the front. Some of the styles were downright scandalous!

"Look at these!" Sarah exclaims, holding up a leopard print thong.

"That's nothing, look at these!" You burst out laughing as you hold up a pair of cotton panties with the words, 'daddy's little girl', printed on them.

The two of you giggle for a while as you sort through the underwear. You don't know why you felt so compelled to buy new underwear, considering that you had plenty of pairs at home. Maybe it was Sarah's infectious attitude that caused you to buy a new pair of underwear.

Finally, you placed the panties back onto the shelves and began to walk away. Before you managed to walk two steps, a single thought raced through your head, "Why not buy something risque? Nobody is going to see them, and it'll be like my dirty little secret."

Turning back around, you resolved to buy a pair.
112.title: Follow Sarah to the back

1121.content:
You take the leopard print thong up to the register and pay for the them. The saleswoman smirks at you as you pay for the item.

"Enjoy your purchase," The saleslady tells you as you and Sarah leave the store.

The rest of the day is fruitless and you soon find yourself driving home. If you're lucky, your parents won't ask too many questions about your day and why you weren't able to find a dress.

You sneak up to your room and toss the bag onto your bed before heading downstairs to dinner. Your new underwear sits on the bed until you return to your room later that night.

As you are changing into your pajamas, it occurs to you that you don't even know if your new thong will match any of your bras. You strip down to just your bra and panties. You quickly remove your plain, boring white cotton panties and slide your legs into your new, sexy thong.

You look yourself over in the mirror. Your black push-up bra goes well with the your new thong, but something looks amiss. Didn't you shave your legs that morning? Of course you did, that's why you woke up so early. But why do your legs look hairy?

Confusion sets in as you stare your legs. Unbeknownst to you, your eyes change to a golden yellow color and your pupils become slits. To your horror, the hair on your body continues to grow out.

You try to shriek in terror, but all that comes out is a low growl.

Your lower back begins to tingle and you soon find it hard to stand upright. Hunching onto the ground, you watch in terror as your hands change into paws. There is a stinging sensation in your pelvis as a tail sprouts out your back.

Several minutes later and the transformation has ended. All of the pain inside of you has subsided. You take a long look at the mirror. Standing where you once stood is solid black cat with yellow eyes.

You try to scream but all you manage is a loud, "meow".

"Honestly, Shadow, I have no idea how you manage to get in here when I'm sure that I close the door every time I leave." Laughs your mother, or rather your owner, as she walks into what once was your bedroom.

Looking around the room, you no longer see your bed, or the posters of boys and bands. Instead, you see a formal office, with a desk and a computer and several filing cabinets.

"Might as well get you fed, I'm sure you're hungry," Your mother declares, turning and walking to the kitchen.

It looks like you won't have to worry about going to Prom after all. Even if you could talk, nobody would believe that you were once a teenage girl on the verge of graduating and moving off to college. Hopefully, your diet of cat food won't taste as bad as it smells.
1121.title: Buy the leopard print thong

1122.content:
You take the pair of cotton panties up to the register and pay for the them. The saleswoman smirks at you as you pay for the item.

"Enjoy your purchase," The saleslady tells you as you and Sarah leave the store.

The rest of the day is fruitless and you soon find yourself driving home. If you're lucky, your parents won't ask too many questions about your day and why you weren't able to find a dress.

You sneak up to your room and toss the bag onto your bed before heading downstairs to dinner. Your new underwear sits on the bed until you return to your room later that night.

As you are changing into your pajamas, it occurs to you that you don't even know if your new panties will even fit you. Striping out of your boring, plain white panties you reach into the bag and pull out the new pair. You pull them all the way up, and surprisingly they are a perfect fit.

You put on a pair of flannel boxers and your favorite tank top with the logo of your favorite band before heading to the bathroom to brush your teeth. Once inside the bathroom, you swear that you are several inches shorter. Shrugging it off as stress you brush your teeth and return to your room.

Jumping into bed, you quickly fall fast asleep. Your dreams are strange, usually you just dream about boys and ice cream. In your dream, you are walking down a long hallway until you come to a pair of doors. One door is labeled, "2", and the other door is labeled, "K". Not sure what the symbols mean, you decide to open a door to find out.
1122.title: Buy the cotton panties

11221.content:
You open the door labeled, "2" and enter. Once inside you are blinded by a bright, white light. As you look around, a gray mist appears to envelope you. Your mind realizes that something is wrong and it struggles to remind you that you are dreaming.

You wake up in a cold sweat, as well as a wet bed. Panic stricken you look around. Your room has changed drastically. All of the posters of boys and bands have been replaced by pictures of cartoons and princess. Your bed is much smaller and is covered by a princess comforter.

Your father walks into your room and sees that you're awake. His smile quickly fades as he sees your wet bed.

"I'm sorry, sweetie, but it looks like you wet the bed. I knew we should have kept you in diapers until you were completely potty trained." Your father tells you as he reaches down and lifts you out of your bed.

It is then that you see yourself for the first time. You are clearly no older than two years old. What happened to you? Were you still dreaming? No, that was impossible, you could feel the dampness of your soaked underwear.

Your father hands you off to your mother, who takes you to the bathroom. She gives you a quick bath and you realize just how tiny you are. After she dries you off, she takes you to your bedroom and puts you onto the changing table that you had not noticed before. She expertly diapers you before she dresses you in a pink and frilly princess dress.

"There we go, such a pretty little princess. You won't have to worry about things like Prom and boys for a good long while." Your mother coos as she holds your hand and walks you into the kitchen.

Your father is now sitting at the table reading the morning paper and drinking coffee.

"Can you believe what those idiots in congress are doing? If they would just compromise with President Clinton then they wouldn't be having talks about shutting down."

Your mother lifts you up and sits you into your booster seat at the table. You stare around the kitchen in dismay. It looks like it always has, except it looks newer in a way.

"Good morning again, sweetie," Your father smiles at you. "Feeling better? Don't worry about wetting the bed. You'll grow up soon enough, but even then you'll still be daddy's little girl."
11221.title: Go through Door 2

11222.content:
You decide to take your chance with the door labeled, "K". As you push the door open, you are bathed in a white light. There is a hazy mist that soon envelopes you and you find yourself coughing. Attempting to walk further into the room is difficult, as it feels like you are walking through toothpaste.

Rubbing your eyes, you slowly begin to wake up. Your room looks and feels different. Gone are all of your posters of boys, bands, and extra good looking movie stars. In its place are posters of princesses, and unicorns. Gagging to yourself, you roll out of your bed onto the floor. You nearly scream as you look yourself over.

You are no longer wearing your lazy day pajamas. Instead, you are wearing a pink nightgown that is covered in fairies. Underneath your nightgown, you feel something damp and uncomfortable. Lifting up the edge of your nightgown, you reveal a soaking wet Goodnite.

Tears fill in your eyes as you almost begin to melt down. How could this have happened? It was only a dream right? You attempt to make your way down to the bathroom before you are stopped by your mother.

"Good morning, sunshine," Your mother exclaims cheerfully. "Ready for a big day of fun? Guess who's coming over later!"

You have no idea how to respond, but judging by your mother's lack of surprise at seeing you, your only bet is to play along.

"I don't know, who?" You ask inquisitively.

"Your babysitter, Sarah!" Your mother shouts, as she reaches down and tickles you.

You begin to giggle furiously at your mother's assault. After several minutes, she pauses, and looks you in the eye.

"Did you have an accident last night?" She asks you, already knowing the truth.

All of the years that you have spent living with your mother have taught you not to lie. She has the weird power of seeing through you. You answer truthfully, and to your surprise she is not angry.

After you take a bath, your mother takes you back to your room where she has laid out an outfit on your bed. There is a pair of pink princess panties, a pair of overalls with a flower on the chest, and a blue and white stripe long sleeve shirt.

Most of your day is spent wandering around your house. Judging by the drawings on the refrigerator, you are enrolled at the local kindergarten. It feels so strange to be so young again, but you are doing a remarkable job of keeping calm and staying in character. Your last glimmer of hope is that Sarah will be able to help you when she comes over.

However, you don't know the best way to explain things to Sarah. Will she even remember that you two were best friends? Maybe everything will work itself out and today is just some weird cosmic anomaly.
11222.title: Go through Door K

112221.content:
Your mother and father have spent the last two hours getting cleaned up for their night out. It seems strange to you that they are going out on a Sunday. You try to ask your mother about this, but just explains that its a work related thing for your father.

You grumble to yourself as you continue to wander around the house. Even though your room is full of dolls and stuffed animals, you have no desire to resort to acting juvenile. To your parents, it looks as if you are just getting cranky and on the verge of throwing a tantrum.

Sarah arrives at five o'clock. Your parents welcome her inside and give her instructions for the evening. Before rushing out the door, your mother and father both give you a big hug and kiss goodbye.

You are now left alone with Sarah.

"So munchkin, what do you want to do tonight?" Sarah asks you, kneeling down and looking you in the eye.

"I want to go to Prom!" You exclaim as you put your hands on your hips and attempt your most intimidating pout ever.

"Sorry, munchkin, but only big girls get to go to Prom," Sarah replies, ruffling your hair. "You'll get to go someday."

You angrily stomp off to your room. Not even your best friend recognizes you anymore. Maybe you will just have to grow back up. But that isn't fair! You start to kick and scream as you work yourself in a hysterical tantrum. Within minutes, you are on your bed sobbing.

Sarah runs into the room and sees you crying. Thinking that she was the cause of it, she tries her best to comfort you.

"How about we play dress up?" Sarah offers. "That way you can dress up like a princess and we can have our own Prom here."

You sniffle as you look at Sarah through your bloodshot eyes. It wasn't much, but at least it was better than spending your entire night crying.

Sarah helps you off the bed and she walks you over to your costume chest. Inside of the chest are all kinds of costumes, not to your dismay they are mostly for princess and ballerinas. One particular item catches your attention though, a pair of white cotton panties with the words, "daddy's little girl", written on them.

"These are for you," You say mischievously as you hand them to Sarah.

"These are so cute!" Sarah replies, as she pulls them up over her jeans attempting to make you laugh.

You giggle to yourself as you watch Sarah. Hopefully, the cursed panties will find someone else to victimize and you can return to your old life.

Sarah gets a strange look on her face, as if she was in pain. She stops what she is doing and immediately runs to the bathroom. Judging from the sounds that she is making, she is vomiting heavily.

Several minutes pass and Sarah finally emerges from the bathroom. Much to her chagrin, she is now as tall and as old as you. She is no longer wearing jeans and a sweater; her outfit changed to a pair of black tights, with a blue ruffled skirt, and a long sleeve black turtleneck.

"What did you do?" Sarah screamed as she raced towards you.

You quickly explain to Sarah how to bought the panties at the mall the day before. As if a light went on in her head, she suddenly began to remember everything.

"But what do we do now?" Sarah asked, shrugging her shoulders.

"For starters, you two are going to brush your teeth before changing into your pajamas," Your mother said turning the corner. "I think you've played enough for tonight. Sarah, I talked to your mother and she said that it was okay for you to spend the night tonight. She'll pick you up after kindergarten tomorrow."

You and Sarah give each other worried glances. After you have finished your nightly routine and and dressed for bed, you and Sarah finally have some alone time to talk.

"This could be the greatest thing that has ever happened to us!" Sarah exclaims, having gotten used to being a child again.

"I know, right!" You giggle. "We are going to be the smartest people in our class."

"We won't make the same mistakes that we made the first time through school," Sarah replies looking up at the ceiling from her sleeping bag.

"Thank you for doing this with me, Sarah," You gratefully tell her.

"No, thank you for wanting me to join you," Sarah replies. "I just wish that I didn't have to wear Goodnites."

"Same here," You respond, poking your diaper through your nightgown. "We just need to relearn how to not have nighttime accidents. And if that's the worst thing we have to deal with, then I'm okay with that."
112221.title: Try to convince Sarah

112222.content:
Your mother and father have spent the last two hours getting cleaned up for their night out. It seems strange to you that they are going out on a Sunday. You try to ask your mother about this, but just explains that its a work related thing for your father.

You grumble to yourself as you continue to wander around the house. Even though your room is full of dolls and stuffed animals, you have no desire to resort to acting juvenile. To your parents, it looks as if you are just getting cranky and on the verge of throwing a tantrum.

Sarah arrives at five o'clock. Your parents welcome her inside and give her instructions for the evening. Before rushing out the door, your mother and father both give you a big hug and kiss goodbye.

You are now left alone with Sarah.

"So munchkin, what do you want to do tonight?" Sarah asks you, kneeling down and looking you in the eye.

"I want to watch a movie," You say as sweetly as possible.

"Of course we can watch a movie," Sarah smiles. "I'm going to have to go make a pizza though, because I'm sure your getting pretty hungry."

You giggle as Sarah tickles your sides. It was strange seeing your best friend like this. You kind of liked the attention that Sarah was showering upon you.

The night goes better than expected. According to Sarah, she was letting you stay up late, despite it only being after eight o'clock. Your eyelids were beginning to droop and you were yawning heavily.

"All right, squirt, it's time to get ready for bed," Sarah replies taking your hand and leading you to your room.

Laid out on your bed is your nightgown and a Goodnite. The accident you had the previous night appears to be a recurring problem and no matter how hard you plead and beg, Sarah is unrelenting and you are forced to wear the diaper.

After brushing your teeth, you get into bed so Sarah can tuck you in. She reads you a story and kisses you on the forehead before turning off the lights and leaving. A nightlight in the corner of your room is glowing and you find yourself drifting off to sleep.

The sound of a car door slamming wakes you up. You look around, you are still a six year-old and fortunately, still dry. You crawl over to the window and look outside. Sarah is talking with your parents.

"No, she was good all night," Sarah explained. "She did pout a little at bedtime though."

"That's understandable," Your mother answers. "Did she act like she remembered anything though?"

"As far as I can tell, she think she's a normal six year-old girl," Sarah replied. "She has no memory of going to the mall or being excited about Prom or graduation."

"Thank you," Your mother replies, handing Sarah a large wad of cash. "I'm just not ready to let my little girl grow up yet."

You watch in horror as Sarah is driven home by your father. Your mother and your best friend had set you up. You were now going to have to grow up again. Tears welled up in your eyes as you threw yourself back onto your bed.

Moments later, you had cried yourself to sleep. When you woke up the following morning, you resolved to make the most of this gift and live a more full life because of it. The first thing you had to though, was change out of your wet Goodnite.
112222.title: Stay in character

12.content:
The outlet store is crowded. People are filling up the aisles and it is uncomfortable to try and squeeze between them. You find yourself grumbling as you and Sarah approach the formal dresses.

There are several racks with dresses, but most of them appear to have been picked clean. Cursing yourself, you regret having waited this long to find a dress; however, its not like you have a date to Prom. What's the point in spending money to impress an imaginary boyfriend?

"OMG! Look at this!" Sarah squeals with delight as she races towards a strapless, lavender dress.

"That looks amazing!" You respond. "What are the odds that we would find the perfect dress within five minutes of arriving?"

"What do you mean, 'we'?" Sarah snottily replies. "This is my dress. You need to find your own."

"You don't need to be so bitchy about it," You huff as you walk towards another rack.

Sitting on a rack, almost unnoticeable, in the back corner of the section sit two dresses. The dress is a pink dress with sequins, glitter, and spaghetti straps. The second dress is a fiery red, strapless affair with a black swirl that circumnavigates the fabric from the floor to the waist.
12.title: Go to the large outlet store

121.content:
You feel a slight tingle as you pay for the pink dress, perhaps the idea of paying over a hundred dollars for a dress that you're only going to wear once is disturbing to you. The cashier bags up your dress, and you follow Sarah outside. She had already paid for her dress and now the two of you were set to explore the mall.

Feeling a loud rumbling in your stomach, you decide that it is time to head to the food court. Having skipped breakfast, you are more than willing to spend some money on greasy mall food.

You and Sarah each find something to eat and then search out an empty table. As you eat, you find yourself giggling more than you normally do. Sarah keeps talking to you, but you are having a harder and harder time understanding some of the words that she is using.

"Like, why do you have to use such big words?" You say, tilting your head to the side.

"Are you okay?" Sarah asks you, with a look of concern on her face.

"Like, I am totally fine," You reply, flipping your hair over your shoulder. "OMG! Look over there! Tommy and Jason are here!"

"Yes, they are." Sarah answers, looking over at the two boys.

"I heard that they don't have dates yet. Maybe we can get them to ask us to the dance." You squeal excitedly.

You wave at Tommy and Jason. They catch your meaning and walk over to you and Sarah.
121.title: Buy the pink dress

choices: The local place by Sarah's house
1211.content:
Tommy was Jason's younger brother. Jason was a senior, the star quarterback, and all around handsome man. It was rumored that his smile brought a puppy back to life.

Tommy, on the other hand, was nerdy and not very popular. He was a junior and the top of his class. It was rumored that he scored a perfect score on the ACT. If anything, you were hoping to use him to get to Jason.

"Hey Tommy," You reply seductively as you bat your eyelashes.

You found it incredibly endearing how you made Tommy blush. Talking to girls was one of the few things that he had not mastered yet. He stuttered with every word he said.

"Shh," You reply, as you put your finger against his lips. "I don't have a date to Prom yet."

"Would you like to go with me?" Tommy squeaked.

"I would love to," You giggle as you lean over and give Tommy a big hug. "Pick me up at six."

Tommy and Jason soon leave after you make your plans. As luck would have it, Jason asked Sarah out. You couldn't help but feel a little jealous. You wanted the star quarterback to be wrapping his arms around you, spinning you across the dance floor, and sticking his tongue in your mouth at the end of the night.

The rest of the afternoon is spent wandering around the mall. There isn't much else that you need, you're having too good of a time with Sarah to care.

"We should schedule hair and nail appointments," Sarah informs you as you're getting ready to leave.

"Like, totally," You reply.

"Should we schedule the appointment here at the mall, or at the local place by my house?" Sarah asks you.
1211.title: Flirt with Tommy

12111.content:
The week goes by quickly, and you soon find yourself driving over to Sarah's house. You are going to drop your dress of at Sarah's before carpooling to the mall. Thankfully, Sarah's mother has agreed to pay for your salon visit. Sometimes, it pays to have friends with rich parents.

When you leave the mall, you and Sarah feel like princesses. You have been wonderfully pampered and your hair looks fantastic.

The rest of the day is spent getting ready at Sarah's house. When Tommy and Jason come to pick you up, you are giddy with excitement. Instead of heading straight to the dance, you stop by a local fast food restaurants just because you want to. You get quite a few stares from people which makes you feel fantastic; but the moment that really made your night was when a little girl, possibly around the age of six, asked her mother to take a photo of the "princess".

The rest of the dance was a blur. You don't remember any of the songs that were played, but you enjoyed yourself immensely. As Tommy dropped you off at Sarah's house, you lean in and give him a long, slow, deliberate kiss.

You can tell that it was Tommy's first kiss. You can also tell that he enjoyed it, judging by the way he was grinning from ear to ear.

Graduation eventually came and went, as did summer vacation. By the time college rolled around in the fall you had forgotten all about Tommy, and Prom. You were busy living your life at the university level. Not wanting to be bored while you were in school, you decided to try out for the cheerleading squad as well as rushing a sorority.

Having never been a cheerleader before, you were actually surprisingly talented and impressed the captains. Your sorority sisters also fell in love with you the moment they laid eyes on you. Everything was going your way.

Everything that is, except having someone to love you. One day, in early May, you received a call from Sarah. She was crying hysterically into the phone, but from what you could make out, she had just been proposed to. You were happy for your friend, but a little saddened that you had not yet found the same happiness.
12111.title: The mall

12112.content:
The week quickly passes and you find yourself heading over to Sarah's house the morning before Prom. The two of you have appointments for a mani and a pedi followed by getting your hair done. Thankfully, Sarah's mom agreed to pay for the whole thing. Having rich friends did have its perks.

By the time Tommy and Jason picked you up, you and Sarah were both in fits of giggles. This was going to be one of the most exciting nights of your life.

All you could think about during the dance was what you wanted to do to Tommy afterwards. You had never felt this amorous in your entire life, but the way that he awkwardly spun you around the dance floor was incredibly charming.

By the end of the night, your feet were sore and you were ready to go home. You and Sarah both agreed to go home with your dates and then meet back up at Sarah's afterwards. Tommy was a shy guy and you imagined that you would make it back to Sarah's before she did. Despite Sarah informing you of her plans to turn Jason down the moment any hanky-panky ensued.

What you didn't expect though, was for Tommy to drive you to a nearby park. He had packed a blanket, several candles, and a bouquet of roses in his trunk. Luck for you, the night was warm, the sky was clear, and it was not windy enough to blow the candles out.

Tommy wrapped his arms around you and began to kiss your neck and shoulders. You moaned in ecstasy as Tommy's hands caressed your body. As awkward as he was on the dance floor, he was more than competent with his hands and mouth.

He pulled a condom out of his pocket, and you stared at momentarily before looking into Tommy's eyes and nodding yes. It was a moment that only last a few minutes, but you remembered it for the rest of your life.

You eventually made your way back to Sarah's and the two of you exchanged stories. Sarah was happy for you and there were many hugs and tears.

Graduation went by in a blur, as did summer vacation. Tommy stayed in touch, and you found that he was actually smarter than you had realized. He was incredibly sweet and treated you like a princess. After dating for three years, he finally proposed to you on the roof of the astronomy building at your college. It was three years exactly from that magical Prom.

After you called your family and told them the news, you immediately called up your best friend Sarah and together you cried over the phone at the happy news.
12112.title: The local place by Sarah's house

choices: Have Jason pick you up at your house
1212.content:
Jason was Tommy's older brother. Jason was a senior, the star quarterback, and all around handsome man. It was rumored that his smile brought a puppy back to life.

Tommy, on the other hand, was nerdy and not very popular. He was a junior and the top of his class. It was rumored that he scored a perfect score on the ACT.

"Hey Jason," You reply seductively as you bat your eyelashes.

"Why, hello there," Jason replies, pulling up a chair and sitting next to you.

"How come the most handsome boy in school doesn't have a date to Prom yet?" You ask Jason, leaning in closer.

"Because I promised Tommy that I wouldn't get a date unless he gets a date," Jason answered, sliding closer to you.

"How about Tommy and Sarah go together?" You answer. "That way you and I can go together. We'll double-date."

Tommy looked over at Sarah, their eyes met and they both blushed.

"I like the sound of that," Jason agreed. "What time do you want us to pick you lovely ladies up?"

"Six, at Sarah's," You quickly answer, while scribbling down directions to Sarah's house on a napkin.

Tommy and Jason soon depart and you are left alone with Sarah.

"What do you think you're doing?" Sarah demanded.

"I was getting us dates for next Saturday," You casually reply.

"That's fine I guess, but what has gotten over you? You've been acting strange since we bought our dresses." Sarah added, concerned over your behavior.

"Can't a girl have fun? Besides, it's like, totally YOLO." You reply, rolling your eyes.

You and Sarah finish your shopping and leave the mall. Sarah is barely speaking to you by the end of the end of the day. School is not much better and the two of your are really starting to get on each other's nerves.

Come Saturday morning, you have had your fill of Sarah and are considering changing your plans for that night.
1212.title: Flirt with Jason

12121.content:
You don't want Sarah ruining your senior Prom, so you give Jason a call and tell him to pick you up at your house. Jason is a little disturbed at the change of plans, but decides to go along with it. He has been sexting you non-stop since the mall, and you have been just as guilty about replying.

If your parents knew what you were planning on doing after the dance, they would definitely not let you go. Nevertheless, you refuse to reveal any secrets and before long Jason is at your front door ready to go.

His truck has been cleaned, but your father still does not approve of Jason. As if your father could tell you how to live you life. He doesn't know what it's like to be a teenager in love.
