The dance is a whirlwind and you soon find yourself getting driven home by Jason. You managed to avoid Sarah the entire night. Jason was even successful in keeping his distance between him and Tommy.

Jason pulled into the parking lot of a nearby park. There were no lights for miles and the stars were shining brightly. He pulled several blankets and pillows out from the backseat of his truck and tossed them into the bed. Within minutes he helped you into the bed of his truck.

The two of snuggled up close together and began to make out. Jason was very rough with his hands and you were starting to feel conflicted. You chalked it up to it being your first time and was just your nerves.

Several minutes later, you were collapsed in a sweating heap in the back of his truck. You had never felt as loved as did at that moment. Jason wrapped his arms around you and kissed your forehead. A smile crossed your lips as you slowly drifted in and out of sleep.

Two months later, Jason had broken up with you and moved on to his next girl. You were devastated, especially after he posted online all of the photos you had sent him. The worst, however, was yet to come.

It was now June, and you only had a few more weeks before you were to leave for college. You figured that the stress from graduation had caused you to miss your period, but that did not explain why you missed it in June as well. Fearing the worst, you drove yourself to the pharmacy and picked up a home pregnancy test.

Later that afternoon, you called up Sarah. Sobbing into the phone you explained about Jason and Prom and positive pregnancy test.
12121.title: Have Jason pick you up at your house

12122.content:
As much as Sarah has been irritating you, you don't want to ruin your Prom by bickering with her. When Saturday arrives, you take your dress over to Sarah's and prepare for your date with Jason.

You and Sarah get your hair and nails done at the local salon by Sarah's house Thankfully, Sarah's mom offered to pay for both of your packages.

By the time Tommy and Jason arrive, you and Sarah are looking absolutely fantastic. You have completely made up and are the best of friends again. Nobody would have guessed that you two had been arguing about Prom for the past week.

The evening was magical and you enjoyed yourself immensely; at least, until the end of the evening when things went sour. Jason and Tommy decided to part ways. Jason was going to drive you home, while Tommy was going to drive Sarah back to her house. It seemed odd to you since you were spending the night at Sarah's house.

You weren't entirely sure, but you thought that you smelled alcohol on Jason's breath. His driving was starting to be erratic and you were glad that you had buckled your seatbelt.

Jason reached over and started rubbing your shoulder. Lights were flashing in your head, but you quickly dismissed them in the hopes that it would keep Jason focused on driving. After several minutes of rubbing your shoulder, his hand moved down to your chest and he began to forcefully grope your breasts.

You brush Jason's hand off of your chest before reaching over and slapping him across his face. He turns and glares at you, with a drunken rage in his eyes.

His momentary lapse of concentration caused his truck to veer off the road. You both screamed in terror as the truck rolled into a tree.

Several days later, you awoke in a hospital. Your parents surrounded you and Sarah was seated in the chair opposite of you.

"What happened?" You quietly squeak.

Your parents explain about the accident and how you were lucky to be alive. They tell you that Jason wasn't as lucky as you and was announced dead at the scene.

Everyone kept hugging you and thanking God that you were all right. Many tears were shed by all.

It took another month, and you ended up missing your own graduation, but you were eventually released from the hospital.

When you arrived home, you saw that there had been some major construction on your house. A ramp had been built to allow you to wheel right in the front door. The doctors told you that you may never walk again, but it was a small price to pay to be alive.

You were still able to go to college, and you still remained friends with Sarah. It was no surprise to you when she called you on the phone day crying hysterically. At first you thought that Tommy had broken up with her, but it turned out that the opposite was true. He had proposed and she wanted you to be her Maid of Honor.
12122.title: Stick to the plan

122.content:
You feel a slight tingle as you pay for the red dress, perhaps the idea of paying over a hundred dollars for a dress that you're only going to wear once is disturbing to you. The cashier bags up your dress, and you follow Sarah outside. She had already paid for her dress and now the two of you were set to explore the mall.

Feeling a loud rumbling in your stomach, you decide that it is time to head to the food court. Having skipped breakfast, you are more than willing to spend some money on greasy mall food.

You and Sarah each find something to eat and then search out an empty table. As you eat, you find yourself more annoyed with Sarah than you normally are. Sarah keeps talking to you, but you all you can hear is whining. Why can't you have friends that are more cheery?

"Can you please just stop complaining for once in your life?" You finally snap.

Sarah looks at you hurt. Her eyes began to fill up with tears.

"My dad has cancer!" Sarah shouted back, causing everyone in the food court to turn and look at you. "I'm sorry that you don't want to hear about it, but this is important to me. You're my best friend and I don't know who else I can talk to about this."

"Life isn't all sunshine and roses," You grumble as you continue eating.

"What happened to you? Why are you acting this way?" Sarah cried out.

Just then, you have a moment of clarity. Why are you acting this way? This isn't like you. You knew that Sarah's dad had cancer. You had even talked with her extensively about it.

"I'm sorry," You mumble an apologize. "You're right, I don't know what came over me."

The two of you finish eating and throw your garbage away. As you are getting ready to leave, you spot Tommy and Jason leaving the game store. Grabbing Sarah's hand you rush over to meet the two boys.
122.title: Buy the red dress

1221.content:
"Hey there, tiger," You say seductively to Jason. "I heard that you two don't have dates to Prom yet."

"You're right, we don't," Jason snorted. "What's it matter to you?"

"Well, Sarah and I both need a strapping young lad to take us," You reply as you bat your eyelashes at Jason.

Tommy, Jason's younger and less athletic brother, was becoming more excited with each passing moment. You could tell that the idea of actually having a date with a woman was something new and exciting to him. It was really cute how he kept trying to nudge Jason and signal that he was interested.

Taking the hint, Jason smiled wickedly at you.

"Sure, we'd love to take you ladies to the Prom," Jason began, looking you over before moving his lustful eyes onto Sarah. "However, this is going to be a double-date. I'm going to take Sarah to the dance, and you and Tommy can go as a couple."

Your eyes bulged out of your head. Of all the people that wanted to go to the Prom with, Tommy didn't even rank in your top twenty; however, you did owe it to Sarah after being especially rude to her. Biting your lip, you reluctantly agreed to go with Tommy. If anything, it would help Sarah feel better and that was what mattered to you at the moment.

After making plans with the boys, you and Sarah continue shopping. Several hours later, you and Sarah say goodbye and return home.

You are feeling more tired than usual, but chalk it up to a long day at the mall. As you fall asleep, you feel that same tingle from earlier.

Tossing and turning, you have one of the most restless nights that you can remember. If you guessed correctly, you got maybe twenty minutes of sleep.

When you finally decide to get out of bed, every single joint in your body aches. Muscles that had never been sore are tender and painful. Your bedroom also seems different; in fact, it looks more like your parents' bedroom.

When you turn on the light to the bathroom, the sight that greets you in the mirror is horrific. Staring back at you in the mirror, is your mother. You reach up to touch your face, and the reflection in the mirror mimics your movements. You think that maybe you are dreaming, but several pinches later and you are still your mother.

"Is everything all right?" Your father asks from the bedroom. "It's only six, we can sleep in for at least another hour."

Panic races through your mind. Do you go back to bed and try to act like nothing has happened, or do you run to your old room and see if your mother is inhabiting your body?
1221.title: Help Sarah get a date

12211.content:
"Everything is fine," You lied in your mother's voice. "I was just surprised by the mirror."

You can hear your father laughing as he laid in bed. Not wanting to arouse suspicion, you use the bathroom and then head back to bed. At least lying down will allow you time to think of a plan of action.

"I see someone's a little frisky," Your father says, as he rolls over closer to you.

"Oh God," You think to yourself, "He thinks I'm mom! Although, I guess I technically am mom at this point!"

Your father, or now your husband, slowly begins to run his hands all over your body. You quiver at his touch as your now mature body responds in kind. He is kissing you all over and your mind is ready to explode at the intensity of the pleasure you are experiencing. Are your parents always this frisky on Sunday mornings?

You open your eyes again. The sun is now shining and the clock says that it is after nine. You are covered in sweat and your hair is a mess. You cover yourself as you walk to the shower. Confused feelings are running through your head. Physically, you are in your mother's body; but mentally, you are still your same old teenage self.

A hot shower does wonders for you and you are beginning to feel much better. After you dry off, you search through your mother's dresser for something to wear. It never occurred to you that your mother had such scandalous tastes in undergarments. All kinds of panties fill the drawers. There thongs, boy shorts, crothless panties, and even briefs. They come in a rainbow of colors and a variety of fabrics.

As you move on to select a bra, you are relieved to find that the selection is much more limited. Instead of two drawers, all of your mother's bras are confined to one drawer. There is easily several hundred dollars worth of underwear spread between the two drawers. The next time you ask your parents for money, you'll have to bring this little tasty factoid up.

Gaining a hold on your senses, you pick the plainest, most ordinary pair that you can find. Then, you go to the closet and find a pair of jeans and a sweater. As you exit the closet, your father pinches your butt and gives you a quick peck on the cheek.

Its now time to find your old body, but upon further inspection, you find that you are nowhere to be found. Maybe you should call your old phone, or maybe you should call Sarah to see if she knows anything about what happened.
12211.title: Act like nothing is wrong

122111.content:
You pick up your mother's phone and search through the contacts. Finding your own number, you call your phone. Several rings later there's an answer and you hear your old voice on the other end.

"Hi sweetie, I was wondering when you were going to finally call," Your mother says in your voice.

"What the hell is going on?" You demanded in the authoritative tone that your mother uses so well.

"Not much, I'm just at a bakery getting doughnuts," She replies.

"And you're not freaked out by this at all?" You ask.

"Why would I be? I'm the one that did this!" Your mother confessed.

"What?" You scream into the phone, causing your father to look at you.

"I got tired of living my old life and decided that I wanted a change," your mother confesses.

"You can't just steal my life!" You shout, even angrier than before.

"Sure I can," Your mother replies. "I got tired of you acting like a spoiled brat all the time that I started looking for a way to fix things. Turns out, I found this amazing necklace at a shop called Morganville at the mall. It has the ability to grant wishes."

"Please, can I have my old life back," You cry into the phone.

"I don't think so," Your mother responds. "You see, this necklace only grants four wishes. After I devised my plan to switch bodies I found a way to make it so that you will never even remember this conversation. Once I took over your body, I wished that you and Andrew, your father, would become incredibly kinky nymphomaniacs and every time you had sex you would forget a little bit more of your old life and remember a little bit more of mine. The way I calculated it out, by the time your graduation rolls around you'll be thinking that you've always been me."

Just then, your father walked in on you. He wrapped his arms firmly around your waist and began to kiss your neck. Your body responded by heating up and becoming aroused. It felt better now than it had earlier. Within minutes, your father had you tied up to the bedpost in your new bedroom.

Several weeks later, you were standing and cheering your daughter as she walked down the aisle to receive her diploma. You had never been as proud of her as you had at that moment. You remembered all of the important times in her life. Sadly though, you wished that your daughter had a better relationship with. It would be fantastic if you could just spend some time with her, or even switch places with her so she knew how difficult it was to be a working mom. You had heard about this new store in the mall that sold unusually artifacts and you figured that it was worth a gander. If nothing else, maybe you'd find something interesting for the bedroom.
122111.title: Call yourself

122112.content:
You feel relieved as you hear Sarah's voice on the other end of the phone.

"Sarah, I've got an emergency and I need your help!" You exclaim into the phone.

"I'm sorry, but I don't think I can help you," Sarah replies. "Have you tried calling my mother?"

"I don't want to talk to your mother, I want to talk to you! You're my best friend and something weird has happened." You try to explain.

"It would probably be best if I explained everything then," Sarah answered. "You see, I'm not really Sarah. I'm her mother, Maggie. We decided that you and Sarah really didn't need to go to Prom next weekend. Instead, we decided to magically switch places with you two so we could go and have a night of fun while you two have to deal with all of our adult problems."

You listen in shock at the bombshell that is dropped on you. Your mothers had planned this all along.

"We will go ahead and switch back to our old bodies after Prom," Maggie explains in Sarah's voice. "Unless, of course, you ruin our lives. Then we will just stay in your bodies and live your lives."

After you hang up with Maggie, you call Maggie's phone in the hopes of getting a hold of Sarah. Sarah answers the phone and talks to you in Maggie's voice. She is just as shocked as you are and can't believe that your mothers were capable of pulling this kind of stunt.

"What should we do?" You ask.

"I think we just need to play along." Sarah replies. "Hopefully our mothers will keep their promise. I don't care if we miss Prom, just as long as we get our old bodies back."

You hang up the phone and walk mindlessly through the house. There is nothing that you can do now but wait and hope that your mother and Maggie keep their promise.

The week is one of the longest weeks of your life. As much as you tried to maintain the illusion that you were not a teenager, you found it incredibly difficult to perform your mother's job. All the while, you watched as your mother enjoyed your teenage life.

Saturday eventually rolled around and you watched your mother get ready for Prom. An anger was burning in side of you, but you were at least thankful that you would get your body back before the end of the weekend.

You said goodbye to your mother as she left to go to Sarah's house. Unfortunately, this meant more alone time with your father. As much as you tried to keep up the act that nothing was wrong, it still felt weird when your father tried to be intimate with you.

At two in the morning, there came a knock at the door. Outside stood a policeman. He apologized for waking you before he told you the bad news. Your mother, and Maggie, were in a car accident involving a drunk driver. Bother your mother and Maggie were killed. Little did the officer know that your mother was in your body and Maggie was in Sarah's.

You now had no one to trade bodies with and were stuck as your mother. At least Sarah was in the same boat as you and you could rely on her for help as you two adjusted to your new roles.
122112.title: Call Sarah

choices: Let your mother take your place at Prom
Keep her home for the evening
12212.content:
You run into your old room, and find your old body sleeping in your old bed. Giving your old body a shake, you quickly wake your old self up.

Your old body rubs her eyes and looks up at you. Their eyes get wide in a terror as they scream bloody murder while pointing at you.

"What the hell is going on?" Your old body screams.

"I don't know, I was hoping you could tell me!" You scream back.

After several minutes of hysterics, that your father wisely decided to stay out of, it is discovered that you and your mother have switched bodies. Neither of you can believe what has happened. It is too surreal.

You spend most of the morning trying to figure out how this happened, but no feasible ideas are produced. Ultimately, you decide to live each other's life until you can find a solution to your problem.

After your mother exits your bedroom to use the restroom, you sneak over to your closet. Inside, you find your fabulous red dress. You sigh in despair as you realize that you spent all that money on a dress that you won't even get to wear once.

"Mom, we need to talk," You say to your mother before you realize how ridiculous it sounds to call your teenage body, "mom".

"Sweetie," Your mother begins, "We need to lay down a couple of ground rules for the time being. For starters, I'm going to be referring to you as 'mom' from now on. It will look really odd if you keep calling me mom. Second, you need to start calling me by your old name. That way we can look like a normal mother and daughter."

"That makes sense," You agree.

"That just leaves one final question," Your mother breathes slowly. "Can I go to your Prom in your place?"
12212.title: Check your old room

122121.content:
It was a long and excruciating week as you try to live your mother's life. You had no idea just how hard her life was. By the time that Prom rolls around, you are more than a little agitated. It would look strange if you stayed at home, so you allowed your mother to go to Prom in your body. At least one of you would be able to have fun.

You sigh as you watch your mother get dressed in the dress that you bought. It pained you to watch her put make up on your face, knowing that she was going to be dancing the night away.

After your mother left with Sarah, you resolved to spending the night as quietly as you could. Hopefully, you and your mother could find a way to switch back to your normal bodies afterwards. Unfortunately, your father had other ideas and he surprised you in the kitchen with a bottle of wine. You had never drank wine before, as you were too worried about getting caught and kicked out of marching band. However, you were technically an adult, so drinking wine was acceptable.

You must have had too much wine, because you found yourself stumbling around the house giggling hysterically. Your father ended up carrying you to the bedroom before you passed out. You don't remember the rest of the night but when you woke up, you were back in your old bed. Your mind is boggled as to how you arrived back in your own body; however, it meant that you no longer had to pretend to be your mother or that you weren't suffering from a hangover.

The following week at school, all of your friends are telling you about how awesome Prom was. You had to play along and act like you knew what they were talking about, despite not having received many details from your mother. Thankfully, you were able to fake your way through enough conversations that no one noticed.

Graduation eventually rolled around and with it came summer vacation. You spent your summer working at a local ice cream store before heading to college in August.

The weeks turn to months, and the months turn to years. As your college graduation approaches, Prom is nothing more than a distant memory. Your boyfriend is now your fiance and you are planning on getting married a week after graduation.

Your mother pulls you aside at graduation for a mother-to-daughter chat. She is acting nervous and keeps looking around to make sure nobody is eavesdropping.

"Sweetie, I have a confession to make," Your mother begins. "Do you remember the little accident we had back at your Prom?"

"Of course I do," You reply. "What about it?"

"I planned the whole thing," Your mother blurts out. "My mother did the same thing to me when I was in high school. I desperately wanted to have a senior Prom that I stole yours. I'm so sorry. The last few years have taught me just how selfish my actions were. I know that this won't make up for it, but this is the magic medallion that I used to switch our bodies. It has been passed down through our family for generations."

You are completely and utterly shocked by your mother's admission. You aren't sure what you're more upset with, the fact that she ruined your senior Prom, or the fact that she has kept hidden a magic medallion from you for all these years.

"I want you to have the medallion now," Your mother continues, handing the medallion to you. "If nothing else, you and your fiance can use it after you're married for some wild nights. Who knows, maybe when you have a daughter of your own, you'll finally get to have the Prom that you missed out on."
122121.title: Let your mother take your place at Prom

122122.content:
It is a long and excruciating week as you try to live your mother's life. You had no idea just how hard her life was. By the time that Prom rolls around, you are more than a little agitated. Deciding that it would be best to keep your mother from embarrassing you at your senior Prom, you tell her that she cannot go in your stead.

Surprisingly, your mother agrees immediately. You can't help but feel that she set you up for this. As strange as it may be, you think that your relationship is actually getting better with your mother.

When Sunday morning arrives, you wake up in your old bed. Your mind is boggled as to how you arrived back in your own body; however, it means that you no longer have to pretend to be your mother.

The following week at school, all of your friends are telling you about how awesome Prom was. It's a shame that you missed it, because it sounds like it was the most amazing time ever.

Graduation eventually rolls around and with it comes summer vacation. You spend your summer working at a local ice cream store before heading to college in August.

The weeks turn to months, and the months turn to years. As your college graduation approaches, Prom is nothing more than a distant memory. Your boyfriend is now your fiance and you are planning on getting married a week after graduation.

Your mother pulls you aside at graduation for a mother-to-daughter chat. She is acting nervous and keeps looking around to make sure nobody is eavesdropping.

"Sweetie, I have a confession to make," Your mother begins. "Do you remember the little accident we had back at your Prom?"

"Of course I do," You reply. "What about it?"

"I planned the whole thing," Your mother blurts out. "I bought a magic medallion at the mall and used it to swap our bodies. I was worried that you were going to get pregnant after Prom so I switched places with you to keep you from going."

You are completely and utterly shocked by your mother's admission. You aren't sure what you're more upset with, the fact that she ruined your senior Prom, or the fact that she has kept hidden a magic medallion from you for all these years.

"I know that it won't make up for what I've done, but I want you to have the medallion now," Your mother continues, handing the medallion to you. "If nothing else, you and your fiance can use it after you're married for some wild nights."
122122.title: Keep her home for the evening

choices: Wait until it gets closer to Prom
1222.content:
"Hey there, sexy," You say as you sashay up to Jason.

Jason is completely caught off guard. He stutters incoherently for a second before greeting you. The two of you are making googly eyes at each other while Sarah and Tommy are looking at each other in embarrassment.

"I need a date for Prom," You say, leaning up closer to Jason. "And I think that you're the kind of guy that needs to take me."

You start to bite your lower lip as you look up at Jason. He is clearly putty in your hands.

"Sure," Jason agrees. "On the condition that Sarah and Tommy can double-date with us."

The more you think about it, the more it sounds like a bad idea.

"That's too bad, I was hoping to spend alone time with you afterwards," You reply as you grab Sarah's arm and begin to walk away.

"What did you do that for?" Sarah yells at you when you are out of earshot of the boys. "Did it ever occur to you that maybe I wanted to go to Prom with Tommy?"

"I'm sorry, Sarah," You apologize, not fully comprehending what just happened.

"I'm sure you are," Sarah sneers as she grabs her bags and storms out of the mall.

With only a week until Prom, you have no date or best friend. Should you try to calm Sarah down now, or wait until it gets closer to Prom?
1222.title: Help yourself get a date

12221.content:
What did you do? You just royally upset your best friend. Racing after Sarah, you manage to catch up to her in the parking lot.

"Sarah, I'm sorry," You stammer, out of breath.

"What's gotten into you today?" Sarah cries out. "You've been acting strange all day."

"It's because I know who I want to go to Prom with," You blurt out.

"Oh really? Who is it, Jason? Tommy?" Sarah rolls her eyes.

"You, Sarah," You answer, keeping your gaze averted to the ground.

"Me?" Sarah replies, unable to form a complete sentence.

"Yes, you," You answer. "You've been my best friend since kindergarten. I want you to be my date for the dance."

"Of course I will!" Sarah answers gleefully, giving you a hug. Her anger vanishing completely.

The week flies by and soon it is the morning of the dance. You drive over to Sarah's house and the two of you spend the morning getting your hair and nails done at the local salon. Thankfully, Sarah's mother agreed to pay for everything. It was one of the benefits to having friends with rich parents.

The dance itself was wonderful. You and Sarah went to a fancy restaurant beforehand and had a grand time. At the dance you had your photos taken together, where Sarah swept you off your feet. The two of you danced all night together, you even allowed several of the boys to cut-in every now and again.

By the time you returned to Sarah's house you were both exhausted. Your parents had agreed to let you spend the night at Sarah's. As Sarah was looking herself over in the mirror, preparing to undress, you walk up behind her and wrap your arms tightly around her waist.

"You looked beautiful tonight," You whisper, before kissing her on her neck.

"You looked pretty sexy, yourself," Sarah replies, making eye contact with you in the mirror.

You let slowly unzip Sarah's dress and help her step out of it. She walks behind you, wraps her arms tightly around your waist and kisses you on the neck before giggling. It's now her turn to unzip your dress and help you out of it.

The two of you are standing in Sarah's room dressed only in your underwear. Your nervous hands begin to caress each other, and slowly you kiss for the first time.

Graduation quickly came and went, as did summer vacation. You found yourself spending more and more time time with Sarah as you prepared to move off to college. You had planned to go to the same college before you started dating, and you were glad that you had even though you weren't roommates the first semester.

By the time that your senior year approached, you and Sarah were madly in love with each other. Most of your time was spent with each other and you could not imagine anyone else making you as happy as she did.
12221.title: Calm Sarah down now

12222.content:
You decide that there is no reason to attempt to calm Sarah down now. She is clearly agitated and does not want to talk to you. Her annoyance with you is present throughout the week as she goes out of her way to avoid you at school.

When Saturday arrives, you call Sarah up in order to make amends. Unfortunately, your plan has backfired. While Sarah does accept your apology, she informs you that she won't be able to go with you to Prom. Tommy apparently chased Sarah down at school on Monday and begged her to go to Prom with him.

You are glad that you and Sarah are best friends again, but disappointed that you are going to be the only girl at the dance without a date. You sulkily make your way back to your room and flop down onto your bed.

Forty-five minutes later, you stop crying and head to the bathroom. After blowing your nose, you look yourself over in the mirror. It is still early afternoon and you have plenty of time to decide whether or not you want to go to Prom.
12222.title: Wait until it gets closer to Prom

122221.content:
It doesn't take long before you have yourself cleaned up. A nice hot shower did wonders for your mood. Since you were unable to afford a trip to a salon, you style your hair and do your nails on your own. After slipping into your red dress, you look yourself over in the mirror. You look fantastic and you cannot wait to flaunt what you've got.

You promise your parents that you will be home by one and that you will call if you're in trouble. Yo're kicking yourself at not having made up with Sarah earlier because you could be spending the night at her house and not worrying about curfew.

Once you arrive at the dance you find a safe place for your purse and mingle with several of your other friends. Eventually, Sarah and Tommy arrive. While not ignoring you, they are completely enamored with each other and not paying much attention to anyone else.

Several of the boys ask you to dance and before you know it, you're having a wonderful time. You're getting spun all over the dance floor and loving it. The night eventually has to come to a close though, and while one of the nerdy boys from your physics class is awkwardly trying to dance with you, you notice Sarah gazing up at Tommy. You can't remember the last time that you have seen your best friend so happy.

Graduation comes and goes, as does summer vacation. Within several months, you find yourself enjoying the college life. Prom is but a distant memory, and you are satisfied with how it turned out. As happy as you were for Sarah, you never talked to her again after you graduated. The two of you went your separate ways and made new friends in college.
122221.title: Go to Prom alone

122222.content:
Prom doesn't sound like it's going to be very fun if you an't go with your best friend. You spend your day moping around the house before your mother finally gets tired and tells you to go outside. You head to the mall and stay until closing time before finding a fast food restaurant. Several of your classmates were at the restaurant instead of going to a fancy restaurant.

You smile meekly as you hide in a booth. After you leave, you drive back to your house. You figure that might as well drown your sorrows with ice cream and a movie.

Graduation comes and goes, as does summer vacation. You quickly adjust to college life and your miserable Prom experience becomes a distant memory. You don't talk to Sarah any more after graduation and the two of you drift apart. At your ten years reunion you discover that she and Tommy have been married for eight years and have three children. You can at least be happy for her, but deep down you still harbor some resentment.
122222.title: Stay home

info.brief_description: It is Saturday morning, you and your best friend are going shopping at the local mall.
info.description:
You wake up Saturday morning full of excitement. There is only week remaining before Prom, and you have yet to select the perfect dress. The entire days is planned out, you and your best friend Sarah are going to spend all day shopping for the perfect outfit. If you're lucky, maybe you'll even find a date to the big dance while you're there. If nothing else, this provides a temporary distraction from your upcoming graduation next month.

I finally completed every single chapter. I wanted to write a full interactive before moving onto another project. Each path will lead to an ending. Some of the endings will be happy while others will not be. Hope you enjoy!
